step.name: add-xml-base
step.short-description: Add explicit xml:base attributes to a document

description.para: The document to add the xml:base attributes to.
Whether to add the xml:base attributes to all elements.
Whether to make the value of the xml:base attributes on child elements of the root relative instead of absolute.

summary.para: The step adds explicit xml:base attributes to the source document. An xml:base attribute annotates an element with a “base URI” value, which is usually the URI this element came from.

description.para: Nodes (elements, attributes, etc.) in XML documents “remember” where they came from: they have a so-called “base URI” attached. This is usually the URI this node came from: the path (for instance on disk) to the document where it belonged to. In most cases the base URI is invisible. The step exposes this by adding (or adapting) xml:base attributes.
The operation of the step depends on the values of the all and relative options:

listitem.para: The root element of the document gets an xml:base attribute with an absolute URI. An existing xml:base attribute is updated.
Child elements where the base URI differs from its parent get an xml:base attribute with an absolute URI. An existing xml:base attribute is updated.
Any other xml:base attributes are removed.

entry.para: These are the default values for these options.

listitem.para: The root element of the document gets an xml:base attribute with an absolute URI. An existing xml:base attribute is updated.
Child elements where the base URI differs from its parent get an xml:base attribute with an relative URI. An existing xml:base attribute is updated.
Any other xml:base attributes are removed.
The root element of the document gets an xml:base attribute with an absolute URI. An existing xml:base attribute is updated.
All child elements get an xml:base attribute with an absolute URI. An existing xml:base attribute is updated.

entry.para: This is not allowed. Error is raised.

detail.para: The xml namespace prefix as used here is bound to the namespace http://www.w3.org/XML/1998/namespace. In most cases you don’t have to bind this prefix explicitly (by adding xmlns:xml="http://www.w3.org/XML/1998/namespace"). This namespace binding is part of the XML language.
A formal definition of base URIs and xml:base attributes can be found here.
